head.title: National Briefing | Science And Health: El Niño Still Expected

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Science And Health: El Niño Still Expected

abstract.p: National Centers for Climate Prediction says warming tropical Pacific Ocean is still on track to produce El Nino for first time in four years by end of 2002; says warming pattern is likely to be much weaker then potent 1997 and 1998 episode (S)

block.p: The warming tropical Pacific Ocean is still on track to produce El Niño for the first time in four years by the end of 2002, the National Centers for Climate Prediction said this week. But the warming pattern is likely to be ''considerably weaker'' than the potent episode of 1997 and 1998, which seared southern Asia. That El Niño was the worst of the 20th century, helping lift the average global temperature to record highs.
